examples: The hole calls the thief.
The organization called the new regulations a turning point in the campaign against smoking.
To call a meeting/strike.
A classic hot chocolate recipe calls for scalded milk to be mixed with cocoa powder and sugar.
You call that mercy?
words.defineEn: a choice made or a judgment reached after considering several possibilities
words.defineVi: một sự lựa chọn thực hiện hoặc một bản án đạt được sau khi xem xét một số khả năng

words.phonetic: tə tʃeɪndʒ wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs maɪnd
words.defineEn: to change one's opinion or decision regarding something
words.defineVi: để thay đổi ý kiến hoặc quyết định của một người về một cái gì đó

examples: The passion fruit smoothie is a popular choice at the café.
The refreshing Muscat grape juice was the perfect choice for a hot summer day.
Camembert is an excellent choice for a picnic.
A Granny Smith apple is a popular choice for juicing.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
words.defineEn: an act of deciding to choose between two things or more
words.defineVi: một hành động quyết định lựa chọn giữa hai điều hoặc nhiều hơn

examples: She chose a knee-length skirt for the office.
May I choose the restaurant?
He chose a seat facing the door.
Many people choose not to marry.
He chose to go.
words.defineEn: to decide what we want to have or what is best for us from a group of options
words.defineVi: để quyết định những gì chúng tôi muốn có hoặc những gì là tốt nhất cho chúng tôi từ một nhóm các tùy chọn

words.word: to [come] down on one side of the fence or the other
words.phonetic: tə kʌm daʊn ɔn wʌn saɪd ʌvðə fɛns ɔːɹ ðɪ ʌðɚ
words.defineEn: to decide between two possible alternatives or choices that one has
words.defineVi: để quyết định giữa hai lựa chọn thay thế có thể hoặc lựa chọn mà người ta có

examples: The crime was committed in broad daylight.
The organization is committed to promoting equality and fairness for every person.
They have committed to a lifetime of love and partnership by getting married.
The government is committed to holding exports at their present level.
You should take a hard look at the issues before committing yourself.
words.defineEn: to state that one is bound to do something specific
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một người nhất định phải làm một cái gì đó cụ thể

examples: The old man considered his granddaughter thoughtfully.
The committee has been considering the report.
The renowned scientist, Dr. Rebecca Thompson, is considered the big enchilada in the field of quantum physics.
Have you considered my feelings?
Have you considered my feelings?
words.defineEn: to think carefully about a possibility or before making a decision
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ cẩn thận về một khả năng hoặc trước khi đưa ra quyết định

examples: "Saving money can be difficult, but little drops make the ocean, and small savings can add up over time," said the financial advisor during the consultation.
The professor's office hours are posted on the door, indicating when he is available for student consultations.

"In a professional setting, above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it, and your attitude and work ethic will determine your success," said the career coach during the consultation.
These decisions could not be made with full consultation.
Sharma directs OSU's student life counseling and consultation service.
words.defineEn: the act or process of discussing something with a person or a group of people
words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình thảo luận điều gì đó với một người hoặc một nhóm người

examples: That contest wasn't fair!
You don't have a prayer in this contest.

I know you worked really hard on this project, but it looks like your cake is dough, and you won't be winning the contest.

words.defineEn: to formally oppose or challenge a decision or a statement
words.defineVi: để chính thức phản đối hoặc thách thức một quyết định hoặc một tuyên bố

examples: So what locations meet these criteria?

words.defineEn: a principle or standard by which something is judged or decided

examples: A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.
The courts decided in favor of the New York claimants.

The case will be decided by a jury.
The government decided to abandon the proposed legislation due to public opposition.
words.defineEn: to think carefully about different things and choose one of them
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ cẩn thận về những điều khác nhau và chọn một trong số họ

examples: The decision is in the hands of the judge.
The decision comes in a case brought by the residents of a small town in Alabama.
This decision is, I feel, a huge mistake.
I can’t make a decision just yet.
The company's profits are on the rocks due to poor management decisions.
words.defineEn: the act of reaching a choice or judgement after careful consideration
words.defineVi: hành động đạt được một sự lựa chọn hoặc phán quyết sau khi xem xét cẩn thận

examples: Of course, not all decision makers are equally powerful.
[maker] and the ultimate decision maker, especially as far as foreign policy is concerned.
This is a good thing, since human beings are not perfectly designed decision makers.
The CDC also says that decision makers must consider the rate of transmission in their community when planning the return to school.

words.defineEn: a person who makes important decisions in a large organization
words.defineVi: một người đưa ra quyết định quan trọng trong một tổ chức lớn

examples: The constitution does not decree the right to keep and bare arms.
He signed a bunch of decrees.
The Ferguson police are also operating under a consent decree.
The Grand Mufti of Saudi Arabia had decreed the war a jihad, and encouraged thousands of Saudis to become holy warriors.
The Parlements registered royal decrees and their members could sell their jobs to the highest bidder.
words.defineEn: an official authoritative decision or judgment, especially one made by  a government or the ruler of a country

examples: The constitution does not decree the right to keep and bare arms.
He signed a bunch of decrees.
The Ferguson police are also operating under a consent decree.
The Grand Mufti of Saudi Arabia had decreed the war a jihad, and encouraged thousands of Saudis to become holy warriors.
The Parlements registered royal decrees and their members could sell their jobs to the highest bidder.

words.defineVi: đưa ra phán quyết, quyết định hoặc lệnh chính thức

words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ cẩn thận về một cái gì đó và xem xét nó trước khi đưa ra quyết định

examples: The government is determined to check the growth of public spending.

words.defineEn: not changing one's decision to do something despite opposition
words.defineVi: không thay đổi quyết định của một người để làm một cái gì đó bất chấp sự phản đối
